intro: Cuphea megapotamica, commonly known as the flamebeard plant, is a member of the Lythraceae family. It is native to Central and South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its striking red, tubular flowers. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, clustered inflorescences that attract pollinators like hummingbirds. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Cuphea megapotamica is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant color and unique floral structure.
